name: Atlassian MCP
description: Atlassian MCP is a tool for managing Atlassian products.
setup_description: Checkout the [Quick Start Guide](https://github.com/sooperset/mcp-atlassian?tab=readme-ov-file#quick-start-guide) for more information.

required.name: JIRA_URL
required.description: The URL of the JIRA instance.

required.name: JIRA_USERNAME
required.description: The username for the JIRA instance.

required.name: JIRA_API_TOKEN
required.description: The API token for the JIRA instance.

required.name: CONFLUENCE_URL
required.description: The URL of the Confluence instance.

required.name: CONFLUENCE_USERNAME
required.description: The username for the Confluence instance.

required.name: CONFLUENCE_API_TOKEN
required.description: The API token for the Confluence instance.

optional.name: ENABLED_TOOLS
optional.description: Comma-separated list of tools to enable. See https://github.com/sooperset/mcp-atlassian/blob/main/docs/tools.md for more information.

optional.name: READ_ONLY_MODE
optional.description: Enable read-only mode. This will prevent the MCP server from making any changes to the Atlassian instance.

default.name: MCP_LOGGING_STDOUT
default.description: Enable logging to stdout instead of stderr.

name: Context7
description: Up-to-date code documentation for LLMs and AI code editors.
setup_description: The MCP server runs plug and play. No configuration is required.
